New Records: Shohei Ohtani hit his 47th home run and stole his 48th base, moving closer to becoming the first player in MLB history with 50 homers and 50 stolen bases in a season.
Tommy Edman homered twice in the same game, the first time doing so from both the left and right sides.
Key Match Events: The Los Angeles Dodgers blew a 7-3 lead but rallies to win 10-8 after Gavin Lux's go-ahead single in the seventh inning.
The Chicago Cubs loaded the bases in the ninth inning but failed to score, preserving the Dodgers' victory.
Pre-Game Insights: The Los Angeles Dodgers were leading the NL West with a magic number of 11 to clinch the division after the game.
Shohei Ohtani's impressive performance set the tone for the game.
Post-Match Reflections: Dodgers manager Dave Roberts praised the team's resilience after the comeback victory.
The win was significant for the Dodgers' playoff push.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cubs won the first two games of the series and took the season series 4-2.
The game was part of a larger series context.
